ing: 3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cut into bite-size pieces
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
1 apple - peeled, cored and cut into eighths
3 small red potatoes, cut into eighths
1 (1.25 ounce) envelope dry onion gravy mix
des: "A savory autumn stew with apple, red potatoes, onion and seasoning. This is a very easy tasty chicken dish I concocted when I was trying to think of a dish like pot roast yet using chicken rather than beef.  My husband hates mushrooms, so I tried condensed celery soup, and it works great.  This dish is light yet very zesty and full of flavor.  You can substitute using chicken thighs, but it will increase calories and fat.  I think using biscuit gravy mix rather than onion gravy mix would work (the flavor would go well with chicken), adding richness, although I haven't tried it that way yet, but again, it would add more fat and calories to this dish. Serve with a side of rice or over noodles."
ins:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Saute garlic and chicken until lightly browned.
Place chicken and garlic in slow cooker; add water, soup, pepper, salt, seasoning, apple, potatoes, onion and gravy mix. Mix all together.
Set heat on Low setting and simmer slowly for 6 to 8 hours.
